comments.body: Where can I find this policy? I wanted to see if the test cases covered the policy.

The file is generated from the configure-helper.sh script, here: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/b2a0315bf5d22f9e0eee9a37caec462137632064/cluster/gce/gci/configure-helper.sh#L752
We should probably move it out of the script to static file, but that's another issue.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +44,48 @@	require.NoError(t, err, "Failed to create temp directory")

	policyFile := filepath.Join(baseDir, "audit_policy.yaml")
	c := ManifestTestCase{
		t:                t,

comments.body: Any reason to not make this a table test?

If I lay these all out as structs, I think it would look like:
```
{
  level: none,
  users: []user.Info{kubeproxy},
  verbs: []string{"watch"},
  resources: []Resource{endpoints, sysEndpoints, services, serviceStatus},
}
```
Which is much more verbose. I could create a testcase geneartor method using a similar technique to what I have now, but IMO that just adds unnecessary complexity.

Do you have something else in mind?
